text:
A default installation of Apache 2.0.4{6|7} consumes 100% CPU upon start-up
of Apache. According to netstat -a, Apache is listenning but not responding.
Error log does not mention anything special. Version 1.3.27 works fine.
System is a p4/2.5GHz with 512mb RAM running Windows XP with SP1 and latest
windows recommended updates.
creator: richard@furda.net

text:
I can verify that.
I have also tried on a "fresh" install of Windows XP PRO XP1, and it still
consumes above 90% of the CPU.
Error also occurs regardless of what partition I install to.
(Note: Running NTFS 3.1 on all partitions)
I haven't managed to narrow down what the problem can be since the computer is
acting like a small server running mail, web, ftp and others (though I tried to
install Apache first)
Microsoft IIS 5.1 is running fine without any problems, just hope I won't have
to use it for too long.

My system: AMD Athlon XP 2100+, ASUS A7V8X  with latest beta BIOS, 768MB RAM,
Windows XP Professional SP1 with all the latest patches.
creator: btn21@btn.serveftp.net

text:
Okay, I may have found the source of the problem and I hope other users can
verify that.
Are you using McAfee Virus Scan 7? If so, try to uninstall that and reinstall
Apache 2.0.47?
Please give feedback on the result.
creator: btn21@btn.serveftp.net

text:
I happened to install McAfee VirusScan 7, and immediately noticed that Apache 
CPU usage jumped to 100%. I did not have this problem before I installed 
VirusScan. The behavior was consistent between Apache 2.0.46 and 2.0.47.
creator: bartek_muszynski@hotmail.com
jwoolley@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8325 ***
